posts.post_content:
No discrimination! That's what I'm talking about! I will always be happy being attacked by this guy. I would clearly know the intentions of its controller; and the intentions of its controller are very clear.  
  
"Why, anyone who attacks you with any ol' 8/8 has clear intentions" you say.  
Really?  
Are you completely sure about that?  
  
Well, let me ask you this: Can another person's intentions be clear if that person him/herself doesn't even know what his/her own intentions are?  
Or, in other words:  
*"Why are you attacking me for 8?"  
"Because your blockers can't kill my dude."  
"Well, I'm down to 2, that other player with 14 flying power on the board is still at 20, and his 'blockers' don't look like they are going to randomly expire anytime soon. So what's going down a couple of turns from now?"  
"Oh, well I don't know..."*  
  
Unlike the above skit, attacking an open player with this Hydra Omnivore is a friendly affirmation that Magic is a bad substitute for Dungeons and Dragons (and an eve... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
No discrimination! That's what I'm talking about! I will always be happy being attacked by this guy. I would clearly know the intentions of its controller; and the intentions of its controller are very clear.

"Why, anyone who attacks you with any ol' 8/8 has clear intentions" you say.
Really?
Are you completely sure about that?

Well, let me ask you this: Can another person's intentions be clear if that person him/herself doesn't even know what his/her own intentions are?
Or, in other words:
"Why are you attacking me for 8?"
"Because your blockers can't kill my dude."
"Well, I'm down to 2, that other player with 14 flying power on the board is still at 20, and his 'blockers' don't look like they are going to randomly expire anytime soon. So what's going down a couple of turns from now?"
"Oh, well I don't know..."

Unlike the above skit, attacking an open player with this Hydra Omnivore is a friendly affirmation that Magic is a bad substitute for Dungeons and Dragons (and an eve... (see all)

Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (6/25/2011 7:31:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like how this card changes in threat level depending on what game type you're playing. Worse than [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper) for duels, very aggressive for 2HG, and absurd in FFA. Just make sure you have a good strategy before you drop this guy in FFA, without haste it gives your opponents alot of time to dislike you for having him in play. Reminds me alot of [Lightning Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Reaver) but on steroids. Synergy with [Keen Sense](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keen Sense) or [Snake Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snake Umbra), [Canopy Cover](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Canopy Cover), [Sigil of Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil of Sleep), [Elder Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elder Mastery), [Grafted Exoskeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafted Exoskeleton), any kind of lifelink like [Loxodon Warhammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Warhammer), [Petrified Wood-Kin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Petrified Wood-Kin), Any doublestrike like [Fireshrieker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireshrieker)...  
I'm glad wizards' is making interesting and playable hydras.
posts.html:
I really like how this card changes in threat level depending on what game type you're playing. Worse than Terra Stomper for duels, very aggressive for 2HG, and absurd in FFA. Just make sure you have a good strategy before you drop this guy in FFA, without haste it gives your opponents alot of time to dislike you for having him in play. Reminds me alot of Lightning Reaver but on steroids. Synergy with Keen Sense or Snake Umbra, Canopy Cover, Sigil of Sleep, Elder Mastery, Grafted Exoskeleton, any kind of lifelink like Loxodon Warhammer, Petrified Wood-Kin, Any doublestrike like Fireshrieker...
I'm glad wizards' is making interesting and playable hydras.
